parameters: Um. Hello. Are you Loli? I was just...
The mayor told me you were coming. What do you want?
Well, uh. I just came back with a Cure for the...
Yes, I know. That was very brave. And they offered
you my grandpa's house next door. Is that right?
Well uh... I mean.
You're in a kind of a tough spot, eh? Cut out
the orphan lady or give up on a beautiful home.
Pretty hard situation, huh?
I think I shouldn't accept the house.
I've never had such a nice place before.
If only there was another way.
I will take the house. I earned it.
I think I shouldn't accept the house.
That's very noble.
I mean it. It's just not right. I'm sorry to have
even considered it.
Well, of course I'm grateful.
Now I feel bad. Is there any other way?
Well, of course I'm grateful.
it's ok. I'll accept the money. I can use that to get
a good start on my life.
You've had a pretty rough time of it, haven't you?
You can do a lot with some money. Improve your life.
You've had a pretty rough time of it, haven't you?
It hasn't been easy. I've made mistakes. The money
will help.
What if you could have both?
What if you could have both?
Even if I could, what would happen to you then?
I have a proposal.
I have a proposal.
I'm listening.
What if I put in a word to the Mayor. I mean, what if
you COULD get the house and the money.
I- I don't follow.
I mean, if you wanted to, perhaps you could lend me
some money to expand the shop. I could easily live
here if I added another room. I don't need the house.
No.
No?
I wouldn't lend you anything.
I would pay for it myself.
That's the only way I could feel right about it.
But the Mayor would have to agree.
Oh. He will. Thank you. I'm beginning to feel glad
that you will be my neighhor.
I feel... very grateful for your generosity.
You did save my life... all of our lives.
None of us will ever forget that.
You can do a lot with some money. Improve your life.
Yes. That's true. Perhaps that is all that has
stood in my way. I think you're right. And I'm
glad. Very glad. I didn't want to take your house,
your grandpa's house, from you.
You are always welcome here.
I hope you will come visit whenever you come
to Applegate.
I will. You can bet on it, Loli.
Now I feel bad. Is there any other way?
I can't think of anything. I should just take the
money and go. I don't belong here.
Don't be daft.
I'm sorry you feel that way.
Don't be daft.
It's just that you and the Mayor all about all I know
here. I'm a stranger.
Haha. A stranger that everyone knows and already loves.
Do you love me, Loli?
Well, yes. In a a way. I'm certainly coming to like
and respect you.
I'm glad. Listen. I've been thinking while we were
talking, and I have a proposal.
I'm listening.
What if I put in a word to the Mayor. I mean, what if
you COULD get the house and the money.
I- I don't follow.
I mean, if you wanted to, perhaps you could lend me
some money to expand the shop. I could easily live
here if I added another room. I don't need the house.
No.
No?
I wouldn't lend you anything.
I would pay for it myself.
That's the only way I could feel right about it.
But the Mayor would have to agree.
Oh. He will. Thank you. I'm beginning to feel glad
that you will be my neighhor.
I feel... very grateful for your generosity.
You did save my life... all of our lives.
None of us will ever forget that.
I'm sorry you feel that way.
Do you hear yourself? What's our problem? You just
saved a whole town from sickness and painful death
and you "don't belong here"? Perhaps if you looked
around at all the grateful people surrounding you..
But I'm still a stranger. Nobody really knows me.
I'm not a hero. I'm not that person that you all see.
I can't live up to it. I can't.
Then perhaps you should take the money and go.
The person who saved our town is not a quitter. I refuse to believe that.
Then perhaps you should take the money and go.
I think that's the right thing to do. Perhaps I'll
return here another day and just be a person, not a
hero who has to be put on a pedestal.
You'll always be a hero. You can't get away from that.
Next time you come, there will probably be a statue
of you. But if you give it chance, you can also be
one of us. I'd like that.
You would?
Yes, yes. Of course. You're a good person. The kind
of person we want in our town. Go if you must, but
come back again once you've sorted it out. Ok?
You are wise and kind. I'll do that. Goodbye...
for now.
The person who saved our town is not a quitter. I refuse to believe that.
I've not always been a hero, you know.
But now you are, and I don't want to see you leave.
I want you to stay.
Why?
I don't know. I think I'm coming to like you. I mean
at first it was just gratitude and admiration. But,
talking to you, I don't want you to leave.
Listen. I just thought of something.
I'm listening.
What if I put in a word to the Mayor. I mean, what if
you COULD get the house and the money.
I- I don't follow.
I mean, if you wanted to, perhaps you could lend me
some money to expand the shop. I could easily live
here if I added another room. I don't need the house.
No.
No?
I wouldn't lend you anything.
I would pay for it myself.
That's the only way I could feel right about it.
But the Mayor would have to agree.
Oh. He will. Thank you. I'm beginning to feel glad
that you will be my neighhor.
I feel... very grateful for your generosity.
You did save my life... all of our lives.
None of us will ever forget that.
Is there anything else you need? (smiles)I mean,
besides a new house?
Yes. I was supposed to see about a shipment of
Apples for the Grocer in the Marketplace.
Oh. Yes. Of course. I had forgotten. They have been
kept cold, but I'm afraid they aren't as fresh...
Er --- Well, they'll still taste good. Full of
vitamins and good stuff, you know. Here ya go.
Would you like to see what I have to offer?
Yes
No
Yes
Come back any time.
No
Be safe, friend.
Bye for now.
I've never had such a nice place before.
That's very sad. So maybe you should accept the house.
I can find somewhere else to go.
Really. You've earned it.

and go. I don't belong here.

Oh... intriguing. You have an idea?

they gave me the money and the house...
What? Why would they do that?
Well, I did just save the whole town.
Because I would use the money to expand your shop so you could also live here.
Well, I did just save the whole town.
I guess you've got a point. But how is that a
compromise?
Because I would use the money to expand your shop
here so you could have a nice house adjoining it.
Wouldn't that make it easier for you?
Haha. Well, I don't know about living in my shop,
but I have to admit it's a clever compromise. See
if the Mayor will agree. If he does... well, I'm
inclined to accept.

Hey, you're the hero who saved us all.
I guess so.
I don't like being called a hero.
I guess so.
Well, I don't think there are words to express my
gratitude - our gratitude. It must have been quite
an ordeal. I heard you fought a hoarde of giant
rats and other monsters all by yourself.
It wasn't quite that dramatic.
Well, I want to find a way to thank you. Here, have
some healthy treats on the house.
You received some healthy treats.
Thanks. That's really nice of you.
You wouldn't happen to have any pain killers?
Thanks. That's really nice of you.
You wouldn't happen to have any pain killers?
Oh, you poor dear. Were you wounded?
Yes. I'm still healing.
No. I just like the way the pills make me feel.
Yes. I'm still healing.
Oh no. Here. Maybe these will help.
You recieved some Pain Pills.
No. I just like the way the pills make me feel.
Well, that's not a good reason to take them. Too many
pills will hurt your health. You should really only
take them if you really need them.
I don't like being called a hero.
Oh. I'm sorry. You're kind of a shy one then?
You might say that.

I'm glad we came to an agreement. Have you spoken with
the Mayor yet about the deal we discussed?
Not yet. I will soon.

I'm so glad you were able to convince the Mayor to
agree to our idea. What do you plan to do now?
I've got a new job traveling and representing a
grocery. I buy and sell various goods. You're my first
stop.
That's great. That sounds like a great opportunity.
Will you be able to spend much time here in Applegate?
I hope to. I will have to travel though.
I'm not sure. I might not be around much.
I hope to. I will have to travel though.
I do hope you'll settle down now that you have a
home nearby... and all.
Yes. This will by my home base now.
I'm glad. It sounds like we'll have a chance to
hang out then.
You said I was your first customer. How can I help?
I need to purchase more Apples
I have several crates of Oranges for sale.
I have some Veggies to sell.
Can you use some pain killers?
I need to purchase more Apples
My normal rate for a crate of apples is $12, but I
will sell then to you for $10 each. How many do you
want?
I'll take 2 cases.
I'll take 2 cases, but I'll pay you $15 each.
Would you sell them for $8 each?
I'll take 2 cases.
That's great. I've got them right here
behind the counter.
You paid Loli $20 for the crates of Apples.
I'll take 2 cases, but I'll pay you $15 each.
No you won't. I already gave you a good deal, but I
won't stand by and let you overpay me. You don't want
to lose your job do you?
Haha. I'll just find a way to pay the next guy less.
I'm not sure I like it, but I won't argue. I can
use the extra to help people in the recovery efforts.
The plague did a lot of harm to our town. The extra
money will help.
Somehow I knew you would find a good use for a little
extra. So it's a deal.
Would you sell them for $8 each?
I would if you asked, but I wish you wouldn't. I'm
trying to help people rebuild after the great sickness.
I already offered you a discount.
Seriously, what's wrong with you?
I'm just doing my job, Loli. I was told to try to get
the best price I could.
And me offering to sell them for $10 instead of $12
wasn't a good deal. You need to learn when enough
is enough.
You're right. I'm so sorry.
I guess if you put it that way, I'll pay $10.
Let's make it $12 then.
You're right. I'm so sorry.
That's all right. Consider it a lesson in good
salesmanship. I know my way around the bargaining
table.
Yes, you're right. Listen, I didn't mean to offend
you, or to seem too greedy. How about I up the ante
and pay you $15 each? I'll make up the difference
somewhere else.
I'm not sure I like it, but I won't argue. I can
use the extra to help people in the recovery efforts.
The plague did a lot of harm to our town. The extra
money will help.
Your generosity puts me to shame. But I feel better
now, knowing that you'll put the money to good use.
I guess if you put it that way, I'll pay $10.
Don't do me any favors.
It was YOUR offer.
It was. Here. Take the crates. Good luck with your
job.
Let's make it $12 then.
All right. I accept. Nice doing business with you.
I have several crates of Oranges for sale.
I have some Veggies to sell.
Can you use some pain killers?
I'm not sure. I might not be around much.
I nearly forgot! I have arranged for some additions
to be made to your shop, if you agree. I've paid the
workers in advance but it's up to you when they should
start.
Oh, I wish you hadn't done that. I really didn't
want you to spend all your money.
Well, their bid was a little lower than expected, so
I was able to keep a little of it. I hope you don't
mind. Do you?
Are you kidding? I wouldn't like you as much if you
weren't careful with money. You know they say a fool
and his money are soon parted. I'm glad you're not
foolish.
So, not to change the subject, but you did say I
was your first customer. How can I be of service,
my friend?

I don't know. I might stick around and settle down.
Awesome! Hey, would you like to help me out a little?
I can pay you.
Sounds good. What can I do to help?
I think I'd like to take some time before I take another job. OK?
